page.title: 03CONSTABLE BURTON (ctd.)
page.content:
There is a large{green}in the centre of the village.In the past the Mill Leat crossed it but this has now been filled in.There are some swings there.The School,a village hall called "The Reading Room" and several cottages all face on to the green. There is also a Post Office,which sells fruit,icecream and postcards,a small grocery shop and a telephone kiosk.
On the main road is the entrance to {Constable Burton Hall}owned by the Wyvill family and on the edge of the village a public house called "The Wyvill Arms".The beck is crossed by a bridge carrying the main road which follows the wall surrounding the Hall grounds.
There are several outlying farms.
